<body class="mediawiki ltr sitedir-ltr ns-0 ns-subject page-Roman_numerals skin-vector action-view vector-animateLayout">
		<div id="mw-page-base" class="noprint"></div>
		<div id="mw-head-base" class="noprint"></div>
		<div id="content" class="mw-body" role="main">
			<a id="top"></a>
			<div id="mw-js-message" style="display:none;"></div>
						<h1 id="firstHeading" class="firstHeading" lang="en"><span dir="auto">Roman numerals</span></h1>
			<div id="bodyContent">
								<div id="siteSub">From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia</div>
								<div id="contentSub"></div>
												<div id="jump-to-nav" class="mw-jump">
					Jump to:					<a href="#mw-navigation">navigation</a>, 					<a href="#p-search">search</a>
				</div>
				<div id="mw-content-text" lang="en" dir="ltr" class="mw-content-ltr"><div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:182px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Colosseum-Entrance_LII.jpg" title="File:Colosseum-Entrance LII.jpg">File:Colosseum-Entrance LII.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">Entrance to section <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> (52) of the <a href="/wiki/Colosseum" title="Colosseum">Colosseum</a>, with numerals still visible</div></div></div>
<p><b>Roman numerals</b>, the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Numeric_system&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Numeric system (page does not exist)">numeric system</a> used in <a href="/wiki/Ancient_Rome" title="Ancient Rome">ancient Rome</a>, employs combinations of letters from the <a href="/wiki/Latin_alphabet" title="Latin alphabet">Latin alphabet</a> to signify values.  The numbers 1 to 10 can be expressed in Roman numerals as follows:
</p>
<dl>
<dd><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Bigmath&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Bigmath (page does not exist)">Template:Bigmath</a>.
</dd>
</dl>
<p>The Roman numeral system is a cousin of <a href="/wiki/Etruscan_numerals" title="Etruscan numerals">Etruscan numerals</a>.  Use of Roman numerals continued after the decline of the Roman Empire.  From the 14th century on, Roman numerals began to be replaced in most contexts by more convenient <a href="/w/index.php?title=Hindu-Arabic_numerals&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Hindu-Arabic numerals (page does not exist)">Hindu-Arabic numerals</a>; however this process was gradual, and the use of Roman numerals in some minor applications continues to this day.
</p>
<div id="toc" class="toc"><div id="toctitle"><h2>Contents</h2></div>

<ul>

</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</li>

</li>
</ul>
</li>

</ul>
</div>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Reading_Roman_numerals">Reading Roman numerals</span></h2>
<table style="text-align:center;float:right">

<tr>
<td><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Symb&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Symb (page does not exist)">Template:Symb</a>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td>"2017" as a Roman numeral
</td></tr></table>
<p>Roman Numerals, as used today, are based on seven symbols:<sup id="cite_ref-gordon_1-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-gordon-1">[1]</a></sup>
</p>
<table class="wikitable">

<tr>
<th> Symbol
</th>
<th> Value
</th></tr>
<tr>
<td> [[I|<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>]]
</td>
<td> <a href="/wiki/1_(number)" title="1 (number)">1</a>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td> [[V|<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>]]
</td>
<td> <a href="/w/index.php?title=5_(number)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="5 (number) (page does not exist)">5</a>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td> [[X|<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>]]
</td>
<td> <a href="/wiki/10_(number)" title="10 (number)">10</a>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td> [[L|<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>]]
</td>
<td> <a href="/wiki/50_(number)" title="50 (number)">50</a>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td> [[C|<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>]]
</td>
<td> <a href="/wiki/100_(number)" title="100 (number)">100</a>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td> [[D|<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>]]
</td>
<td> <a href="/wiki/500_(number)" title="500 (number)">500</a>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td> [[M|<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>]]
</td>
<td> <a href="/wiki/1000_(number)" title="1000 (number)">1,000</a>
</td></tr></table>
<p>Numbers are formed by combining symbols together and adding the values. So <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> is two ones, i.e. 2, and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> is a ten and three ones, i.e. 13. There is no zero in this system, so 207, for example, is <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, using the symbols for two hundreds, a five and two ones. 1066 is <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, one thousand, fifty and ten, a five and a one.
</p><p>Symbols are placed from left to right in order of value, starting with the largest. However, in a few specific cases,<sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2">[2]</a></sup> to avoid four characters being repeated in succession (such as <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> or <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>) these can be reduced using <a href="/wiki/Subtractive_notation" title="Subtractive notation">subtractive notation</a> as follows:<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3">[3]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-martelli_4-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-martelli-4">[4]</a></sup> 
</p>
<ul>
<li> the numeral <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> can be placed before <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> to make 4 units (<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>) and 9 units (<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> respectively)
</li>
<li> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> can be placed before <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> to make 40 (<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>) and 90 (<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> respectively)
</li>
<li> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> can be placed before <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> to make 400 (<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>) and 900 (<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>) according to the same pattern<sup id="cite_ref-sun_5-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-sun-5">[5]</a></sup> 
</li>
</ul>
<p>An example using the above rules would be 1904: this is composed of 1 (one thousand), 9 (nine hundreds), 0 (zero tens), and 4 (four units).  To write the Roman numeral, each of the non-zero digits should be treated separately.  Thus 1,000 = <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, 900 = <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, and 4 = <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>.  Therefore, 1904 is <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>.
</p><p>Below are some examples of the modern use of Roman Numerals.
</p>
<ul>
<li> 1954 as <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> (Trailer for the movie <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=The_Last_Time_I_Saw_Paris&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="The Last Time I Saw Paris (page does not exist)">The Last Time I Saw Paris</a></i>)<sup id="cite_ref-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-6">[6]</a></sup>
</li>
<li> 1990 as <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> (The title of musical project <a href="/wiki/Enigma_(musical_project)" title="Enigma (musical project)">Enigma</a>'s debut album <i><a href="/wiki/MCMXC_a.D." title="MCMXC a.D.">MCMXC a.D.</a></i>, named after the year of its release.)
</li>
<li> 2014 as <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> - the year of the games of the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> (22nd, Winter) <a href="/wiki/Olympiad" title="Olympiad">Olympiad</a> (in <a href="/wiki/2014_Winter_Olympics" title="2014 Winter Olympics">Sochi</a>)
</li>
</ul>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Alternative_forms">Alternative forms</span></h3>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:182px;"><a href="/wiki/File:BadSalzdetfurthBadenburgerStr060529.jpg" title="File:BadSalzdetfurthBadenburgerStr060529.jpg">File:BadSalzdetfurthBadenburgerStr060529.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">A typical clock face with Roman numerals in <a href="/wiki/Bad_Salzdetfurth" title="Bad Salzdetfurth">Bad Salzdetfurth</a>, Germany</div></div></div>
<p>The "standard" forms described above reflect typical modern usage rather than a universally accepted convention. Roman usage varied greatly and later use has not been consistent.<sup id="cite_ref-adams_7-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-adams-7">[7]</a></sup>
</p><p>Roman inscriptions, especially in official contexts, tend to use additive forms such as <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> rather than subtractive forms such as <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>. Both methods appear in documents from the Roman era, even within the same document. "Double subtractives" also occur, such as <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> or even <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> instead of <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>. Sometimes <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> are not used, with instances such as <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> rather than <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> or <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-8" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-8">[8]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-9" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-9">[9]</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:182px;"><a href="/wiki/File:AdmiraltyArchLondonCloseup.jpg" title="File:AdmiraltyArchLondonCloseup.jpg">File:AdmiraltyArchLondonCloseup.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">An inscription on <a href="/wiki/Admiralty_Arch" title="Admiralty Arch">Admiralty Arch</a>, London. The number is 1910, for which <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> would be more usual</div></div></div>
<p>Such variation and inconsistency continued through the medieval period and into modern times, even becoming conventional. <a href="/wiki/Clock_face" title="Clock face">Clock faces</a> that use Roman numerals normally show <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> for four o’clock but <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> for nine o’clock,<sup id="cite_ref-10" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-10">[10]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-pickover_11-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-pickover-11">[11]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-12" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-12">[12]</a></sup> a practice that goes back to very early clocks such as the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Wells_Cathedral_clock&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Wells Cathedral clock (page does not exist)">Wells Cathedral clock</a>. This is far from being an unvarying convention; the clock in Elizabeth Tower on the <a href="/wiki/Palace_of_Westminster" title="Palace of Westminster">Palace of Westminster</a> in <a href="/wiki/London" title="London">London</a> (aka "<a href="/w/index.php?title=Big_Ben&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Big Ben (page does not exist)">Big Ben</a>"), for example, uses <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-pickover_11-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-pickover-11">[11]</a></sup> Inscribed dates appear in different forms even in the modern era; on <a href="/wiki/Admiralty_Arch" title="Admiralty Arch">Admiralty Arch</a>, London, 1910 is shown as <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> rather than the “standard” <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> and on the north entrance to the <a href="/wiki/Saint_Louis_Art_Museum" title="Saint Louis Art Museum">Saint Louis Art Museum</a> 1903 was inscribed as <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> rather than <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-13" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-13">[13]</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="History">History</span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Pre-Roman_times_and_Ancient_Rome">Pre-Roman times and Ancient Rome</span></h3>
<p>Although Roman numerals came to be written with letters of the Roman alphabet, they were originally independent symbols. The <a href="/wiki/Etruscans" title="Etruscans" class="mw-redirect">Etruscans</a>, for example, used <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, for <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, of which only <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> happened to be letters in their alphabet.
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Hypotheses_About_the_Origin_of_Roman_Numerals">Hypotheses About the Origin of Roman Numerals</span></h4>
<h5><span class="mw-headline" id="Tally_sticks">Tally sticks</span></h5>
<p>One hypothesis is that the Etrusco-Roman numerals actually derive from notches on <a href="/w/index.php?title=Tally_stick&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Tally stick (page does not exist)">tally sticks</a>, which continued to be used by Italian and <a href="/wiki/Dalmatia" title="Dalmatia">Dalmatian</a> shepherds into the 19th century.<sup id="cite_ref-14" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-14">[14]</a></sup>
</p><p>Thus, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Angbr&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Angbr (page does not exist)">Template:Angbr</a> descends not from the letter <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Angbr&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Angbr (page does not exist)">Template:Angbr</a> but from a notch scored across the stick. Every fifth notch was double cut i.e. <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, <i>etc.</i>), and every tenth was cross cut (<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>), <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, much like European <a href="/wiki/Tally_marks" title="Tally marks">tally marks</a> today. This produced a positional system: <i>Eight</i> on a counting stick was eight tallies, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, or the eighth of a longer series of tallies; either way, it could be abbreviated <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> (or <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>), as the existence of a <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> implies four prior notches. By extension, <i>eighteen</i> was the eighth tally after the first ten, which could be abbreviated <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, and so was <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>. Likewise, number <i>four</i> on the stick was the I-notch that could be felt just before the cut of the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> (<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>), so it could be written as either <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> or <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> (<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>). Thus the system was neither additive nor subtractive in its conception, but <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Ordinal_number_(linguistics)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ordinal number (linguistics) (page does not exist)">ordinal</a></i>. When the tallies were transferred to writing, the marks were easily identified with the existing Roman letters <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>.
The tenth <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> or <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> along the stick received an extra stroke. Thus 50 was written variously as <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, <i>etc.</i>, but perhaps most often as a chicken-track shape like a superimposed <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>: <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>. This had flattened to <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> (an inverted T) by the time of <a href="/wiki/Augustus" title="Augustus">Augustus</a>, and soon thereafter became identified with the graphically similar letter <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>. Likewise, 100 was variously <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, or as any of the symbols for 50 above plus an extra stroke. The form <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> (that is, a superimposed <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>) came to predominate. It was written variously as <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> or <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, was then abbreviated to <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> or <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, with <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> variant finally winning out because, as a letter, it stood for <span lang="la"><i>centum</i></span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Category_handler&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Category handler (page does not exist)">Template:Category handler</a>, Latin for "hundred".
</p><p>The hundredth <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> or <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> was marked with a box or circle. Thus 500 was like a <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> superimposed on a <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> or <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> — that is, like a <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Angbr&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Angbr (page does not exist)">Template:Angbr</a> with a cross bar,— becoming <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> or <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> by the time of Augustus, under the graphic influence of the letter <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Angbr&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Angbr (page does not exist)">Template:Angbr</a>. It was later identified <i>as</i> the letter D; an alternative symbol for "thousand" was <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> (or <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rnor</a> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>), and half of a thousand or "five hundred" is the right half of the symbol, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> (or <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rnor</a> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>), and this may have been converted into <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Angbr&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Angbr (page does not exist)">Template:Angbr</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-15" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-15">[15]</a></sup> This at least was the false etymology given to it later on.
</p><p>Meanwhile, 1000 was a circled or boxed X: <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, and by Augustinian times was partially identified with the Greek letter Φ <i><a href="/wiki/Phi" title="Phi">phi</a></i>.  Over time, the symbol changed to <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>.  The latter symbol further evolved into <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, then <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, and eventually changed to <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> under the influence of the Latin word <span lang="la"><i>mille</i></span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Category_handler&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Category handler (page does not exist)">Template:Category handler</a> "thousand".
</p>
<h5><span class="mw-headline" id="Hand_signals">Hand signals</span></h5>
<p>Alfred Hooper has an alternative hypothesis for the origin of the Roman numeral system, for small numbers.<sup id="cite_ref-16" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-16">[16]</a></sup> Hooper contends that the digits are related to hand signals. For example, the numbers <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> correspond to the number of fingers held up for another to see. <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, then represents that hand upright with fingers together and thumb apart. Numbers 6–10, are represented with two hands as follows (left hand, right hand) 6=(<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>,<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>), 7=(<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>,<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>), 8=(<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>,<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>), 9=(<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>,<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>), 10=(<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>,<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>) and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> results from either crossing of the thumbs, or holding both hands up in a cross.
</p>
<h5><span class="mw-headline" id="Intermediate_symbols_deriving_from_few_original_symbols">Intermediate symbols deriving from few original symbols</span></h5>
<p>A third hypothesis about the origins states that the basic ciphers were <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> (or <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>) and that the intermediary ones were derived from taking half of those (half a <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> is <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>, half a <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> is <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> and half a <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a> is <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Rn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Rn (page does not exist)">Template:Rn</a>).<sup id="cite_ref-17" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-17">[17]</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Middle_Ages_and_Renaissance">Middle Ages and Renaissance</span></h3>
<table class="vertical-navbox nowraplinks hlist navbox" cellspacing="5" cellpadding="0" style="float:right;clear:right;width:22.0em;margin:0 0 1.0em 1.0em;background:#f9f9f9;border:1px solid #aaa;padding:0.2em;border-spacing:0.4em 0;text-align:center;line-height:1.4em;font-size:88%;"><tr>
<th class="" style="padding:0.1em;;;">
<a href="/wiki/Numeral_system" title="Numeral system">Numeral systems</a> by culture</th>
</tr><tr>
<td class="" style="padding:0 0.1em 0.4em;;">

<dd>

</li>

</li>
</ul>
<dl>
<dt> Other historical systems</dt>
<dd>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>

</li>
</ul>
</tr><tr>

</tr><tr>

<li> <a href="/wiki/Unary_numeral_system" title="Unary numeral system">1</a>
</li>

</li>
<li> <a href="/wiki/Ternary_numeral_system" title="Ternary numeral system">3</a>
</li>
<li> <a href="/wiki/Quaternary_numeral_system" title="Quaternary numeral system">4</a>
</li>
<li> <a href="/wiki/Quinary" title="Quinary">5</a>
</li>

</li>
<li> <a href="/wiki/Septenary" title="Septenary">7</a>
</li>
<li> <a href="/wiki/Octal" title="Octal">8</a>

<li> <a href="/wiki/Nonary" title="Nonary">9</a>

</li>

</li>

</li>

</li>
<li> <a href="/wiki/Hexadecimal" title="Hexadecimal">16</a>
</li>
<li> <a href="/wiki/Vigesimal" title="Vigesimal">20</a>
</li>
<li> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Base_24&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Base 24 (page does not exist)">24</a>
</li>

</li>
<li> <a href="/wiki/Base_27" title="Base 27">27</a>
</li>
<li> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Base_32&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Base 32 (page does not exist)">32</a>
</li>

</li>
